title: Rivals Collide

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The Daein army is working with Begnion? That's unexpected, to say the least...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Why would Daein join the war? I thought all their resources would be tied up in reconstruction.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Yeah, that bothers me too. There's something weird about all of this. Didn't Daein resent Begnion's occupation? Why would they be so quick to help out their former enemy?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Why does not matter. We are running out of time. We must deal with this quickly, if we are to get home.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: General Skrimir! Have you recovered from your wounds already?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Yes. Do not underestimate the healing power of the beast tribe.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: All right, everyone's here. Let's begin the meeting.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The immediate threat is the Daein army. They're dug in around the area that we'll have to use to cross the Ribahn. Maybe we can find another spot to cross?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: No, we can't afford it. If we waste any more time, the Central Army will catch up to us. If that happens, we're dead.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf, tell me your impression of the Daein army. Anything special?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: ...Well, there weren't very many of them, but their morale was really up there. Their commander seemed very clever, as well.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It must be the Maiden of Dawn.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Who?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: She was the hero of the recent Daein uprising. Micaiah is her name, if I recall correctly. Supposedly she has performed miracles and turned many losing battles into victories. An interesting figure.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Miracles? I'm finding that a bit hard to swallow. Are you sure about that?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Who knows? Personally, I doubt it. All I know is that the Daein army believes in her miracles, which makes her dangerous.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: This Maiden of Dawn is supposed to be the savior of Daein, whose miraculous powers freed their people from tyranny. In other words, her followers are fanatics who see her as a goddess. She will make a formidable enemy.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: If we attack them head-on, the fighting won't stop until one side is decimated. There's got to be a way to avoid that, right?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: What about a decoy force, like we've used in the past?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: The decoy only worked because the enemy didn't expect it. I wouldn't count on the same strategy working twice.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Not necessarily. The empire assumes superiority over all other countries. Begnion is only using the Daein army as a pawn to stop us, and likely won't care if it is destroyed in the process. As such, the Daein army is most likely uninformed about our past tactics.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You might have a point there. I went scouting after the fog cleared, and their forces looked really unprepared to fight us. They had no ballistae, and they hadn't fielded many fire mages. It felt like they didn't know a thing about fighting laguz.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Then we should definitely have a decoy force hit them head-on, while the bulk of the army crosses the river in the meantime.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I'll head up the decoy force, then. The armies of Gallia and Phoenicis can cross the river while we fight.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I'll go with you, Ike. Daein would get suspicious if they didn't see any laguz in the enemy force.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Sounds like a plan to me. Take some of my men as well, if you want. I don't want their talons getting dull.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The Laguz Alliance may have lost the war of might. But we haven't lost the war to save the lives of our brothers! This fight will be ours!

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Yes! With the fangs and wings of the laguz and the knowledge of the beorc, we will return home!

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Daein cannot stop us now, just as they could not stop us during the Mad King's War. We can do this!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: The laguz failed to cross the river. This is their last chance to try. This time, they'll attack with beorc as well.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe, you know what that means. If we end up fighting beorc...

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I know. We'll probably be fighting the Greil Mercenaries. I'm aware. It's not going to be pretty.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe. Tell me more about Commander Ike.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Why? You used to hate it when I said anything about him.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I want to know more about the man I'll be fighting against. What kind of a person is he?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Well, let's see... He's generous. He doesn't care about petty things. He holds no prejudice against laguz, nor does he care about the opinions of the nobles. He's a master swordsman. He accomplishes everything he sets out to do. He's a true hero.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I see. He sounds...quite different from King Pelleas.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Micaiah, they don't even compare. King Pelleas lacks any leadership or decision-making skills.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: ...That may be, but I believe in King Pelleas. His heart is in the right place. I believe in his virtuous nature and his commitment to being a good king...

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Even though he would set you out on a war that doesn't involve Daein at all? A war of bigotry and hate, fighting on the same side as our real enemies? You're smarter than this, Micaiah.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe, we've been through this. I know we're about to fight Ike and the Greil Mercenaries, but I...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It's time. Shall we?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Sigh... Those two are still here. So much for friendly advice, I guess. Now it's friends against friends... Things are getting crazy around here.

battle.speaker: Zihark
battle.line: The Greil Mercenaries... They really are here. There's no way we can win this. Sorry, guys. I'm turning back for now. I really suggest you all retreat as well.

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: My friends... It grieves me to meet again under these circumstances.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Sir Haar! Why are you fighting for these people?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Hey, you stole my question! Why are you fighting in the Daein army?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: There was a war to liberate Daein while you were gone. So I joined the army again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Well, it looks like you did a good job. Daein has been liberated. So why are you still with the army?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: I can't just leave! These people are my friends!

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Oh, stop with the sentimental nonsense, Jill. In case you haven't noticed, you're fighting your friends, too.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: What about you, then? How did you end up in this fight?

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Well... Somehow, I got mixed up in putting down uprisings in Crimea. And then I ended up with the Laguz Alliance because...you know, being old friends with Ike and all that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: What?! That is hardly a cause worth fighting for!! You're unbelievable!

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: All right, enough debating. What do you want to do now? Do you want to fight me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Of course not! I could never...

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Then join me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Easy for you to say!

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: You're full of doubt. How do you live like that all the time? Is that how your father wanted you to live? Afraid to trust your own instincts?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: But...

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Daein has no business in this war. You know that, right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: But...what about my comrades? What about my friends?

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Is dying how you show loyalty? If you're really their friend, then fight alongside us! Maybe that will get them to think about what they're doing.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Oh, Captain...

recruit-talk.speaker: Haar
recruit-talk.line: Come with me, Jill. We both know that we should follow our hearts, even if it makes us traitors. We know that better than anyone. For the sake of your father, live your life without shame.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Y-you're right, Captain Haar! I've been so foolish. Just as before. I would be proud to serve with you. And...Captain Haar? Thank you. Thank you so much...

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Jill! I can’t believe it! It is you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Oh, Mist...

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: I’m so glad to see you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Wh-what?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Well, I was wondering about what to do if I saw you here with the Daein army. I had it all worked out, you see? And, well, here you are! It’s great!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Mist. We’re enemies now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: No, you have to listen, Jill. Let’s not fight. There’s a really easy solution to this whole mess!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: But... what?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Just listen! It’s so simple! Since Daein shouldn’t be in this war, they shouldn’t be here right now, right? And you and I are friends, right? So we can each pretend that the other one of us isn’t here! Isn’t that great?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Mist, that makes absolutely no sense. Besides, that’s no the issue here! You’re a mercenary. You know how th–

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: We’re not fighting. That’s final.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Mist?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Jill, you’d never turn your weapon against me. I just know it. I trust you, because you’re my friend.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Oh, Mist... All right, that’s it. I’ve had enough of this.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Jill?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: You made my last doubts fade away. I’ve made my decision. I’m not fighting in the Daein army anymore. I’m joining back up with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: Jill! I knew you’d come around!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: I feel bad for my comrades in Daein, but I’m going to stand by what I believe. I will not be ashamed anymore.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mist
recruit-talk.line: That’s the Jill I know and love!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Mist!

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: My wounds... They're nothing! They're nothing compare to what my people have suffered! We won't lose! We'll never give up!

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: You must be Ike, of the Greil Mercenaries.

recruit-battle.speaker: Ike
recruit-battle.line: And you're the Maiden of Dawn, Micaiah?

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: I feel like I know you already. Maybe it's because Sothe has told me so much about you.

recruit-battle.speaker: Ike
recruit-battle.line: I hate to do this to Sothe, but if you stand before me as my enemy, you'll get no mercy from me.

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: ...Good. I prefer it that way. Prepare yourself!

recruit-battle.speaker: Soren
recruit-battle.line: ...Ah, that explains quite a bit about the stories that surround you.

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: Who are you? You're... You're just like me!

recruit-battle.speaker: Soren
recruit-battle.line: Yes, they call our kind the Branded. As the years pass, I understand better and better how others see us.

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: You are so...cold. It's like you're cloaked in frost. Is there even blood in your veins?

recruit-battle.speaker: Soren
recruit-battle.line: There is. Blood very similar to yours, in fact. Blood that teaches us what it means to be rejected and alone.

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: Your heart is frozen, but I feel a warm core trying to melt through that ice. I see... You have someone you cherish very much. Someone you rely on.

recruit-battle.speaker: Soren
recruit-battle.line: Do not presume to understand me, you ridiculous girl. You have no idea who I am and what I can do. None at all. Daein has no business in this war. I will defeat you swiftly and send you and your army back to Daein.

recruit-battle.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-battle.line: I finally meet my own kind, and he is an enemy... ...I will not retreat. I won't let you go any further!

character-falls.speaker: Jill
character-falls.line: They're so strong... Even stronger than three years ago. Lady Micaiah, I apologize. I must head back for now.

character-falls.speaker: Fiona
character-falls.line: Most impressive! I cannot fight with a wound like this. I'll be back shortly...

character-falls.speaker: Meg
character-falls.line: Oww! Sorry, y'all. I'm turnin' back for now.

character-falls.speaker: Aran
character-falls.line: Be careful! They're much stronger than any of the foes we've encountered! They defeated me, as well... I'm falling back temporarily.

character-falls.speaker: Laura
character-falls.line: Oh no, is this...blood? I'm sorry, Lady Micaiah. I must heal my wounds.

character-falls.speaker: Edward
character-falls.line: Ugh...! My ribs... Sorry, Micaiah. I've gotta fall back!

character-falls.speaker: Leonardo
character-falls.line: We're totally outclassed in this battle. This is insane. Micaiah, I'm sorry. I have to turn back for now...

character-falls.speaker: Nolan
character-falls.line: Blast! They're better than I expected! I'm sorry, Micaiah. I need to turn back for a while.

character-falls.speaker: Black Knight
character-falls.line: Stand aside. You are no match for me.

battle-talk.speaker: Reyson
battle-talk.line: Micaiah, the Maiden of Dawn... Is that what they call you?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Who are you? Your wings look just like Rafiel's.

battle-talk.speaker: Reyson
battle-talk.line: I am Reyson. My brother told me about you. That is why I'm here. Please pull back your troops. Our enemy is not Daein. This is not your fight. Am I not correct?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I know how you feel... Though I owe a debt to Rafiel, I cannot do what you ask. It's not that I don't want to! I think this whole war is madness! But I must keep fighting.

battle-talk.speaker: Reyson
battle-talk.line: Why is that?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: This fight is my king's will. I cannot stop fighting just because I don't agree with him. If we don't pull together under our new king, Daein will fall apart again, just as it did before its liberation. I believe in King Pelleas. I believe that our king will lead the people of Daein to happiness.

battle-talk.speaker: Reyson
battle-talk.line: ...I see. I understand your position. Please accept my apology for asking the impossible.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What? What do you mean?

battle-talk.speaker: Reyson
battle-talk.line: You are fighting to protect your beliefs. I understand that now. But remember that we also cannot, and will not, pull back. We both carry a heavy burden. That's why we're here.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Yes...

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Oh...

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Ilyana! I remember now... You said that you were a member of the Greil Mercenaries in Ashnard’s War.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Yes.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I’m sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Let’s not do this. Please?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What?

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Let’s not fight.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: If that means letting the Laguz Alliance get by us, I cannot agree to it.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: I see... That’s too bad.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: How is everyone in the caravan?

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: They’re fine.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I’m glad to hear that.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Maybe... we should fight.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What?

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: We’re enemies now. We can’t stand here and try to have a normal conversation. It’s too strange...

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Ilyana...

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: It’ll be all right. I’m really strong against your spells, and my magic is not powerful enough to defeat you. We’ll be fine.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: But if we’re equally matched, why should we fight at all? It sounds... wrong.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Of course it’s wrong! The fact that we’re fighting is all wrong! We don’t even dislike each other!

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Let’s just fight and pretend like this conversation never took place.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Lady Micaiah!

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Jill...

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Lady Micaiah... I cannot continue to fight for Daein. It’s all gone wrong. I’m here to tell you that... This is good-bye. I must part ways with you.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I... see.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: I am joining the Laguz Alliance. But it’s not because I want to fight the Daein army.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Jill, I don’t understand...

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Please retreat! There is no reason for Daein to get involved in this war. You know that better than anyone, Lady Micaiah! This is madness!

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I can’t do that.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: ...Very well. I will not give up hope. I’ll stand before you as many times as it takes. I will get you to leave this fight.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Jill...

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Zihark...

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: As you can see, I’m with the Laguz Alliance now. I can’t lie to myself anymore, Micaiah. I’m sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I see...

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Tell me, Micaiah. Why did Daein become an enemy of the laguz? Daein has a new king now. Why can’t it escape the grip of Begnion?!

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I don’t know, Zihark. I wish I did. I’m sorry...

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: No, I’m the one who should be sorry. I know this isn’t your fault. It’s just that... now I wonder if the time I’ve spent fighting to liberate Daein was well spent. It makes me sad.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Will you cut me down?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: That depends on you, Micaiah. Will you try to kill me?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: You are an enemy of Daein now. But... I... How could I? How could I possibly kill you?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: I feel the same way. I couldn’t possibly hurt you. However, fighting laguz is something I will not do for anyone. Where do we go from here?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I... I don’t know...

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: Just as you have a reason to fight, so do we.

end.speaker: Ulki
end.line: ...Janaff. The king is calling us.

end.speaker: Janaff
end.line: Hmm, right. Good! Looks like we did it! Ike! The main force has crossed the river. We did it!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Excellent. Everyone, push through! Let's meet up with the main force!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: The beast soldiers are behind us! We're being attacked from behind!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: The Gallians?! How did they cross the river?!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: It's not just the beasts! There are hundreds of hawks, as well!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Even the hawk tribe is here? The Begnion army never told us that they had moved out...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: ...They got us. Commander Ike's force was just a decoy.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Staying will only increase casualties. Let's retreat.

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: No, Maiden! We can still fight! Please give us your orders!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I have. We shall retreat! I will not let all of you die in vain!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: General's orders. We kept our losses to a minimum. That's enough for this battle.

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: Yes, sir!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah, I'm surprised. This is the first time you couldn't predict the enemy's movement.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...You're right.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah?! What's wrong?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, don't... Just act...normal. Everyone...is watching...

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: What? Micaiah failed to eradicate the Laguz Alliance?! No!

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Hmm, this looks bad, King Pelleas. Is this how the people of Daein repay Begnion for all the kindness it has offered them? I'm afraid Daein and the senate's friendly relationship stops here.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: P-please, wait! Give me one more chance, I beg of you!

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Well, well... Since you begged, I suppose... I will consider it.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Please, just listen... Daein remains loyal to the senate. We will carry out any task give to us. Your whim is our command. Just, please give us another chance!

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Very well. We shall overlook your failure this one time. But only once. Farewell, young king of Daein.
Pelleas...

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: ...Mother!

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: That man you were speaking with... He is a senator from Begnion, correct? Duke Lekain of Gaddos, I believe? He was here before as part of the empire's inspection team. He came in Duke Persis's stead.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Yes. You are quite right, Mother. That was Vice-Minister Lekain of Begnion. So you saw us together...

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: Tell Mother what happened. You look absolutely terrified. Does that man have something on you? Is he trying to hurt you? It's all right to tell your mother th--

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: No. It's quite all right, Mother. We were talking about the future of our two countries, and how we might...repair our relationship.

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: But--

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Please go back to your room. I shall go rest as well. I find myself very tired of late.

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: Pelleas... Wait! Oh, my son...

narration: The diversion created by the Greil Mercenaries allows the Laguz Alliance to slip successfully past the Daein army's blockade.

Yet General Zelgius and his Central Army show no mercy and continue their relentless pursuit of the Laguz Alliance. The weakened alliance is forced to a hard choice: they must pass through the northern edge of the Serenes forest. From there, they will try to make their way to a hidden road that will lead them out of Begnion and back to Gallia.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: So, it happens to be that I have a very rare and precious item in my possession. Which one of you thinks you deserve a gift?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Ooo, me! Me! I want it!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: No, Captain! You should give it to me! After all, I’m your faithful servant.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: What!? No way! That stuffy know-it-all doesn’t need it! Look at me! I’m so tiny and helpless, I need all the help I can get. You wouldn’t want me to get hurt, would you?

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: A stuffy know-it-all?! Oh, I say! How dare you, madam!? Captain Ranulf! You know that rewarding her behavior will only encourage her to act up in front of others! Have I not always followed your orders without question, both quickly and effectively?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: All right, all right... Sheesh. You know, I personally don’t really care which of you gets it.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: You hold it right there, Kyza! I think you just called me a brat!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Pfft. I’m only stating the obvious. If you don’t like it, don’t act so childish.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Hmph! You stuck-up old alley cat!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Stuck up?! Your mother would be ashamed at your lack of manners!

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Argh! Stop already! I’m sorry I asked. Obviously I have to make the decision for you. All right, Kyza! This is yours. Take it.

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Oh, thank you! Thank you! You’ve made me the happiest person in the army, Captain! Hah!

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: What!? Why!? Why did you give it to him!?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: He’s your commanding officer.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: That’s not fair! He’s a stuffy old bore! And I’m wearing my prettiest collar...

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Forget it, Lyre. The captain knows who slaves day and night to keep the army running smoothly!

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: No, no, no! The captain’s love is mine! All mine! Give it to me!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: If you want it, you’ll have to take it!

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Oh, you’re dead!

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: What is it with you two? Sigh...
